greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts each equal to 5 mod 6.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) ~ Gamma(5/6) * exp(Pi*sqrt(n)/3) / (4 * sqrt(3) * Pi^(1/6) * n^(11/12)) * (1 - (55/(24*Pi) + Pi/144) / sqrt(n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 27 2015, extended Jan 24 2017
Euler transform of period 6 sequence [ 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, ...]. - _Kevin T. Acres_, Apr 28 2018
mathematica: nmax=100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1-x^(6*k+5)),{k, 0, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 27 2015 *)
xref: Cf. similar sequences of number of partitions of n into parts congruent to m-1 mod m: A000009 (m=2), A035386 (m=3), A035462 (m=4), A109700 (m=5), this sequence (m=6), A109708 (m=7).
results.author: _Erich Friedman_, Aug 07 2005
ext: Changed offset to 0 and added a(0)=1 by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 27 2015
